Came from your tweet destin

Thank you so much Destin. I was just re-visiting your old videos as I’m quarantining with my girlfriend. I’ve been watching your videos since your start on YouTube, and feel kinda special for being here for the whole journey between older model high speed cameras, to interviewing the president, into the present. You inspire me, remind me of my grandfather who was a great engineer/inventor, obsessed with precision and mechanics. I don’t know if you’ll ever see this comment, but just wanted to say how awesome your gifts of knowledge and curiosity have been over the years. I re-watch your videos often, and usually catch something I missed previously, making me smarter EVERY day :) you rock man. I feel like you’re a friend who helps me grow and be a better, educated & aware human. 🙏🏼 cheers from CT. I want to become a patron on patreon when my $$ is stable. :) thank you again.

@destinws2 If you're interested in what frame rate you need to capture the crack propagation: they propagate with the velocity of sound (transverse or longitudinal, that depends) in the glass. For a length of 0.1 m and a velocity of ~1500 m/s, the crack propagation takes 7e-5 s, so you've got about 7 frames of crack propagation at 1e5 fps. Than again, you probably already knew that. Thanks for the cool videos!
